name: treatment of used domestic refrigerator, uncontrolled dismantling | used domestic refrigerator | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/21275/documentation

The activity models the unsafe treatment of a large used domestic refrigeration machine by physical dismantling in an unsafe and uncontrolled manner. The process takes place in an informal recycling site in the capital of Ghana, Accra. Metal recovery (steel, copper and aluminium) is a source of income for the informal recyclers and hence is the major motive behind this process. This dataset models air emissions from a) venting the refrigerant present in the refrigeration machine as well as from b)  breaking the polyurethane insulation that releases the blowing agent of the foaming. Any geographical and temporal distinctions and climate situation are irrelevant for this UPR-LCI. ;The UPR-LCI averages three types of refrigerations machines based on the refrigerant they contain. Calculations regarding the average fridge are found on the table attached. ;Dataset Icon: Corpuses of refrigerators after manual extraction of steel, copper and aluminium (Source: Öko-;Institut 2010). ;Reference: Siddharth Prakash & Andreas Manhart, 2010. Socio-economic assessment and;feasibility study on sustainable;e-waste management in Ghana. Retrieved online at: https://www.oeko.de/en/publications/p-details/socio-economic-assessment-and-feasibility-study-on-sustainable-e-waste-management-in-ghana/;References for refrigerant: ;Sampson Atiemo, Lambert Faabeluon, Andreas Manhart, Letitia Nyaaba, Tobias Schleicher, 2016, Baseline Assessment on E-waste Management in Ghana, Sustainable Recycling Industries. Accra, June 2016. Retrieved online at http://www.sustainable-recycling.org/sampson_2016_sri-ghana/ on 31/01/2018.;Amoyaw-Osei, Y & Agyekum, O.O. & Pwamang, John & Thiébaud (-Müller, Esther & Fasko, R & Schluep, Mathias. (2011). Ghana e-waste country assessment. SBC e-waste Africa project. 

Activity starts with the reception of the used refrigeration machine by the informal recycler. Transportation is not include in this LCI.

Activity ends when the recycler removes all valuable metals. Activity includes emissions to air.
category: E:Water supply; sewerage, waste management and remediation activities/38:Waste collection, treatment and disposal activities; materials recovery/383:Materials recovery/3830:Materials recovery

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Physical and unsafe dismantling of used domestic refrigeration machine without any temporal distinction.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Physical dismantling performed in uncontrolled manner without the use of protection equipment, oftentimes performed with simple tools, if any. No use of anti-pollution equipment either.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: Estimations or conclusions were drawn beyond the original observation points, as those were reported in literature. Assumptions and calculations performed are well documented.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Data collection took place using literature.

flow.name: used domestic refrigerator
flow.category: E:Water supply; sewerage, waste management and remediation activities/38:Waste collection, treatment and disposal activities; materials recovery/383:Materials recovery/3830:Materials recovery

exchanges.description:
According to literature a domestic refrigerator has circa
-5.14 kg of Isocyanate for foaming (Cabinet)
-1.33 kg of Isocyanate for foaming (Door)
-0.38 kg of Cyclopentane for foaming (Cabinet)
-0.10 kg of Cyclopentane for foaming (Door)
-3.81 kg of Polyether polyol for foaming (Cabinet)
-0.99 kg of Polyether polyol for foaming (Door)

exchanges.description:
The amount represents emissions from uncontrolled venting of the refrigerant that is contained in the refrigeration circuit of an average machine. According to literature, there are 85 g of refrigerant R600a in the refrigerator machine. The latter amount is then multiplied with the normalised units (3288 units) and thereafter divided by the total amount of refrigeration machines (6519 units).
Reference: Rüdenauer, I.; Gensch, C.-O.: Environmental and economic evaluation of the accelerated replacement of domestic appliances. ÖkoInstitut e.V., Freiburg 2007. Retrieved online at: https://www.oeko.de/en/publications/p-details/environmental-and-economic-evaluation-of-the-accelerated-replacement-of-domestic-appliances/ on 31st of January 2018.

exchanges.description:
The amount represents emissions from uncontrolled venting of the refrigerant that is contained in the refrigeration circuit of an average machine. According to literature, there are 226 g of refrigerant R134a in the refrigerator machine. The latter amount is then multiplied with the normalised units (2976 units) and thereafter divided by the total amount of refrigeration machines (6519 units). This accounts for circa 0.1032 kg of HFC-134a emissions to air. Additionally, emissions from the blowing agent trapped in polyurethane foaming that functions as insulation for the refrigerator. Emissions correspond to an average machine. According to literature, there are on average 392 g of refrigerant R134a trapped in the insulation foam (from the refrigerator machines that use R134a as refrigerant). The latter amount is then multiplied with the normalised units (2976 units) and thereafter divided by the total amount of refrigeration machines (6519 units).
Reference: Rüdenauer, I.; Gensch, C.-O.: Environmental and economic evaluation of the accelerated replacement of domestic appliances. ÖkoInstitut e.V., Freiburg 2007. Retrieved online at: https://www.oeko.de/en/publications/p-details/environmental-and-economic-evaluation-of-the-accelerated-replacement-of-domestic-appliances/ on 31st of January 2018.

flow.name: 1,1,1,2-Tetrafluoroethane
flow.category: Elementary flows/Emission to air/high population density

exchanges.description:
The amount represents emissions from the blowing agent trapped in polyurethane foaming that functions as insulation for the refrigerator. Emissions correspond to an average machine. According to literature, there are on average 460 g of Cyclopentane trapped in the insulation foam (from the refrigerator machines that use R600a as refrigerant). The latter amount is then multiplied with the normalised units (3288 units) and thereafter divided by the total amount of refrigeration machines (6519 units).
Reference: Rüdenauer, I.; Gensch, C.-O.: Environmental and economic evaluation of the accelerated replacement of domestic appliances. ÖkoInstitut e.V., Freiburg 2007. Retrieved online at: https://www.oeko.de/en/publications/p-details/environmental-and-economic-evaluation-of-the-accelerated-replacement-of-domestic-appliances/ on 31st of January 2018.
